title: Woman feels 'butchered' after horrifying wax treatment at Auckland salon
text:
Woman feels 'butchered' after horrifying wax treatment at Auckland salon Last updated 16:00, February 11 2017 GOLNEZ BASSAM TASBAR 
Golnez Bassam Tasbar suffered scarring to her face after having a facial wax procedure done at iCandy Nail and Waxing salon in Ponsonby. 
What was supposed to be a standard beauty treatment has left an Auckland woman with burns on her face and feeling like she has been "butchered". 
Golnez Bassam Tabar was urged by friends to see a plastic surgeon after a facial wax at a Ponsonby salon left her with torn skin and raw marks across her face. 
She suffered from blotchy burns under her right eye and on both sides of her mouth. GOLNEZ BASSAM TASBAR 
The scarring the day of the procedure. 
"It feels like I've put my face in acid... it looks hideous," Bassam Tabar, 35, said. 
READ MORE: 
Bassam Tabar said she was familiar with beauty treatments and paid for an arm and facial waxing at iCandy Nail and Waxing salon on Friday. GOLNEZ BASSAM TASBAR 
The burn below her right eye. 
A small amount of warm or hot wax it applied to an area around the mouth or side of the face before it is ripped off. 
"It was an average amount of pain, there was nothing out of the blue," she said. 
But it wasn't until her work colleagues noticed "very red and very raw" looking blotches appear on her face that she knew the procedure wasn't done right. 
"It was already feeling sensitive but my colleagues said it looked terrible." Ad Feedback 
Bassam Tabar went back to the salon and asked for a refund, but she said the store simply refused. 
When she asked for aftercare treatment, she was given a squirt of aloe vera gell in a eyelash container. 
"I was horrified. My face felt like it had this burning sensation all over... they weren't even shocked, it was just appalling." 
Bassam Tabar posted on the salon's Facebook page pictures of her burned face. It was there she discovered a slew of complaints from other customers. 
"Whatever you do, do not use the waxing services at this salon," one review read. 
Another comment read "ENTER IF YOU DARE". 
She said the store then offered her a refund if she took her post down, an offer which she had accepted. 
But the scarring procedure forced Bassam Tabar to seek LED red light healing treatment from a skin clinic the next day. 
Bassam Tabar said she was considering taking legal action over the damage done to her face. 
"You're not supposed to walk out of a beauty clinic with skin ripped off. 
"I would expect a certain standard of service and care from a salon in Ponsonby." 
An iCandy staff member who identified herself as the manager refused to comment when approached. "Stop talking," she said, and hung up the phone. 
The salon posted on Facebook to say it no longer offered facial waxing.
